page.title: 15Local Interview
page.content: Laurence Sands is a retired solicitor; ex Mayor; Trustee of The Stewart Trust who administer the affairs of Burnby Gardens; a Governor of Pocklington School; and Director of The Anglican Church Restoration Fund. {Q. How many tourists visit the Gardens A. Last year we had a record number of visitors, about 24,000 paid fees plus local people who pay nothing. {Q. As a Governor what is your {involvement with Pocklington School?} A. My father was headmaster from 1915 to 1944. I became clerk to the governors in 1942 and retired in 1975. At my last meeting I was co-opted as a governor and I have been ever since. {Q. What changes have you seen?} A. The school has roughly doubled in size since 1944, with equal numbers of boarders and day boys who are brought in by bus and car.
